headline: Simple Garlic Shrimp
description: This garlic shrimp recipe couldn't be easier or tastier. Shrimp are pan-seared with lots of garlic and topped with a perfectly lemony, buttery sauce.

video.description: Watch as Chef John reveals the secrets to making perfect garlic shrimp.
video.name: Simple Garlic Shrimp

name: Simple Garlic Shrimp
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons cold butter, cut into 4 equal pieces, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a heavy skillet over high heat until it just begins to smoke. Place shrimp in an even layer on the bottom of the pan and cook for 1 minute without stirring.
Season shrimp with salt; cook and stir until shrimp begin to turn pink, about 1 minute.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes; cook and stir for 1 minute.
Stir in lemon juice, caper brine, 1 piece of butter, and 1/2 of the parsley; cook until butter has melted, about 1 minute.
Reduce heat to low and stir in remaining 3 pieces butter. Cook and stir until butter has melted, sauce is thick, and shrimp are pink and opaque, 2 to 3 minutes.

Remove shrimp with a slotted spoon and transfer to a bowl; continue to cook butter sauce, adding water, 1 teaspoon at a time, if too thick, about 2 minutes. Season with salt to taste; serve shrimp topped with the pan sauce and remaining parsley.

review.reviewBody: Delicious!! I used white wine instead of the brine per someone's review. Had w linguine. And used dry parsley. So good! Yum, yum, yum.

Delicious! Just about perfect! But— I moved the shrimp to a warm buttered pan after the first minute or so they wouldn’t overcook. Also I added an extra 2-3 tbsp lemon juice to extend the sauce. Served over cauliflower rice with side of broccoli.

I'm allergic to shell fish but I took precaution to make it for my wife and daughter. Paired along with filet mignon, salad and baked potato. The only change I made was cutting the parsley amount in half and increased the crushed red peppers by 50%. They really enjoyed the shrimp. I gave 4 stars only because I can't eat the shrimp.
I used the parsley but I think cilantro would have made this dish even better. No complaints; it's quick and delicious.
Delicious and easy recipe!! And yes, the caper brine adds a wonderful note to the taste. Don't skip it!!
Easy & excellent!!!

We loved it. I loved that Chef John's ingredients are generally things that are stamples in our kitchen (our parsley is withstanding the winter outside somehow :) I set aside the shrimp once cooked in another pan (with butter) while cooking the sauce. Moved the shrimp back. Took a little pasta and rolled it on the pan where I moved the shrimp to (not leaving any goodness in that pan) and moved everything to the original pan (then added the rest of the pasta. Delicious! Thanks Chef!
Simple and great. Be sure not to cook the shrimp too long. Also ok to substitute cilantro for the parsley
Perfect amount of garlic. Easy to make. Impressive to guests!
amazing
As, unfortunately, I cook for one. Cut recipe in half. Followed exactly. Chef John, you did not disappoint. Delicious and So easy!
Super easy! Be ready, it moves fast! Served with Gold rice and broccoli! A big hit with my husband!

I have no idea why these reviews are so high. Perhaps there was too much water from the shrimp that made its way into the sauce, but it didn’t have a lot of flavor and the sauce never thickened as it said. It’s also way too much time to cook shrimp so I took the shrimp out when it was getting overdone, about midway through. The ingredients sounded promising, but it didn’t make any sense at the end.
Amazing!
Didn't change a thing. The recipe was so delicious and quick. Will make again and again. Loved it!
ok
I used olive brine and too much at that. But it was still good, just very tart.
Great recipe. I LOVE garlic ...this was superb and fantasticly simple. Will definitely make this regularly!!!

Chef John’s recipes rock, my go to most of the time. I made one tweet I think pushed it into my keepers file. I had excess fresh jalapeños around, not too hot, I diced one fine and added early. Also served over pasta, perfect.
Quick. Easy. I thickened the sauce a bit. I made enough to freeze for next time. I will add shrimp. Tastes great. Looks appealing. Smells good.
Excellent!

Chef John does it again! Amazing! I served with Chef John’s Broken Spaghetti Risotto from this site and a match made in heaven! You do need to move quickly - a few shrimp did get over cooked as I didn’t remove fast enough but overall, wonderful! Only change was used dried parsley vs fresh. I’m already looking at my menu calendar to make again. Thank you!!
Perfect Garlic Shrimp. Absolutely delicious.
Loved this recipe. Easy to make and husband approved. Like another reviewer, I did not have caper brine so used white wine. Perfect!
Wow! Delicious. I used this in tacos, along with black olives, red onion, avocado, romaine & a smear of soft Brie. Hubby loved it as well.
Excellent! Left out the caper brine. Maybe next time I'll include it.
I used jumbo shrimp, doubled the recipe, and I think it's some of the best shrimp I've ever made. Part of the trick is to cook it for a minute without stirring, as the recipe says.
Amazing! Chef John never disappoints.
This is my 2nd time making this recipe and followed it to the "T". Next time, if I'm not too lazy or hungry, I will toss with angel hair pasta and quadruple the recipe.

Absolutely delish! I accidentally left out the pepper flakes (forgot to pull them out in advance) and omitted the salt - figured the caper brine would cover that. The timing was spot on, shrimp was done perfectly. Served it with garlic noodles - is there really any such thing as too much garlic?
This was easy, quick and delicious. Just have all ingredients prepped ahead, it’s ready in a flash.

I’ve cooked shrimp with olive oil, red pepper flakes, lemon juice and garlic a million times. Even the cold butter is nothing new; but, what on earth did that caper brine do?! I found this recipe searching for a quick dinner for one. The only thing I added was parmesan, unnecessarily. (I over-cooked the shrimps a tad…didn’t matter.) I wish I had at least a noodle or two for that sauce…or even a heel of bread. Ugh! Low-carbing is maddening for a sauce this good.
Needed a quick shrimp dish and this one was perfect, everyone enjoyed the buttery flavour

I love garlic and butter and this dish really isn’t expensive if you already have the butter, pickled capers and parsley. It’s not much more than the cost of frozen dinners and so much more delicious. I was more generous with the butter and I doubled it to serve 3 of us. I added a box of Pasta Roni angel hair garlic and herb to put under the shrimp with butter sautéed mushrooms. So good with a green salad!

Amazing!! Made just as outlined and it was tasty! I agree that it goes fast, so have all ingredients lined up. I've made as weekday dish with fresh green beans, or for friends on the weekend with pasta. Success on both counts!!
Simple and very tasty. My family loved it! Another home run from Chef John.

WOW! Added white wine to lemon juice and caper brine, as well as a tiny minced shallot. YUM!!! After cooking down the butter sauce I added cherry tomatoes, angel hair pasta and some grated parmesan. Served on top of some fresh baby spinach! Kids and husband ate it UP!

One word, 4 syllables......DELICIOUSNESS!! I didn’t change a thing and my family loved it. I’m not that great of a cook so my loved ones are calling it my “one hit wonder”, but I’ll take it as thus far, it’s my greatest cooking related compliment from them .

I made no changes to this recipe, I had all ingredients. I followed the directions exactly to include cooking times. My teenage son even commented that it was cooked perfectly! You nailed it Chef John! Thanks for sharing!
Absolutely delicious and really easy to make. I served over angel hair pasta and it was excellent. A definite repeat!!
Very good

Made this Amazingly balanced tasting dish; the garlic, red pepper, lemon juice, and brine all worked well to keep any one item from being overstated. After making it once, I was immediately asked for a repeat within the week! The suggestion to get all prepped prior to starting was great, as you must take action every minute or so, as shrimp cooks quickly.

I think this was fine but originally had less sauce and flavor than my family likes. I started out by using 1T olive oil and 1T quality lemon flavored olive oil and extra butter. I definitely used the caper juice -- great idea. I used unconcentrated organic lemon juice (2T to start). I didn't have fresh parsley but had fresh dried so I crumbled and threw that in.

 My shrimp started to cook too quickly so I removed the shrimp from the pan and took advantage of making more sauce since I had some leftover angel hair.

I eyeballed, and added to taste, more of all the ingredients...lemon olive oil, a good size pat of butter, more minced garlic, pepper flakes and parsley...then once the garlic was soft, a little more lemon juice, caper juice...some Himalayan sea salt. I had some leftover Chardonnay (wonderful La Crema from Monterey, CA), added probably a 1/4-1/3 c. (hard to tell how much was left), and cooked on low heat until the alcohol evaporated. Dish changing. I added the shrimp and tossed so as to not overcook it even more.

It was a hit with my picky husband. My adult son, too. Wish I had more angel hair leftover as they really liked the extra sauce. 

An aside...I would've liked to have added a few capers but I was afraid the picky husband wouldn't eat it.

The photo shows all that was left. It made a good amount of large shrimp.
absolutely delicious the kids really enjoyed it and they're picky eaters.
This is one of my favorite shrimp dishes. It's my go to for shrimp either plain or added to pasta.
Came out delicious! Thanks Chef John
It was fantastic! Very garlicy! My family loved it. It would also be good over pasta like a scamp sauce!

Recipe was a good base for me. I used it because it was simple. I didn't have the caper/juice or fresh parsley. It was still really good! I used a little dry parsley. I also added diced red bell pepper.
this recipe is easy to make and very fast, my family really enjoyed it. we even used the left overs in street tacos and that was also enjoyed.

Omg, this recipe was to die for. My only other comment is that people buy shrimp of varying sizes so the times suggested should be thought about when you cook according to size and the vessel used to cook them in. I only needed half the time suggested but amazing flavor!!!
Perfect as is. I served it over cauliflower mashed potatoes and it was amazing!

The recipe should be specific about the size of the pan. I used a large one; so that I could add the pasta to the cooked shrimp and incorporate the shrimp and its juices. Needless to say, the shrimp was burnt and dry.

Another technique learning recipe. Great stuff. The importance of preparation, heat management, butter management, garlic management. Killer tasty shrimp.
It is in my rotation. Thank you Chef John!
I forgot to take a picture womp womp womp. It was a great, easy and simple recipe. I will have to find a way to make it with less butter.

Amazing & simple recipe! I recommend wild caught shrimp, and adding a 1/3 cup of cooking wine (Chardonnay) into the lemon juice. I used a little oil/juice from my jarred stuffed jalapeños in lieu of caper juice. I laid the shrimp upon a flavorful (but not overpowering) toasted sourdough bread. My wife and I were in indoor dining heaven!

This recipe is simple to make and I love garlic, but the total time shown for having the shrimp still in the skillet is 5 to 6 minutes! That's too long, so following the recipe to a tee would turn your precious shrimp into spongy hockey pucks. Add the shrimp later in the cooking process, three minutes is enough.

I followed the recipe including using the caper juice and it was excellent. My 12 year old daughter said that she would eat a bowl of the sauce like it was soup! LOL Watching the video was helpful and having the ingredients measured and ready is a must. Will definitely make again.
I followed the recipe exactly. Just didnt have capers. Im not sure if it was the small shrimp I choose or what but the shrimp turned out over cooked
Very delicious! Very quick and easy! After making the shrimp, we also made some angel hair pasta and soaked it into the sauce before serving out. Highly suggested!

It's a good recipe, the capers for sure make the recipe. I didn't have the red pepper, so I added a bit of curry.

The next time I make this I'm going to use white wine or chicken or fish broth for starting the shrimp. The broth that is left I will pour over angel hair pasta. This will make a nice entree.
Simply delicious. Followed the recipe as described.

OMG! Absolutely wonderful recipe. I am unable to have vinegar so I couldn’t use the Caper brine and my husband didn’t want to over use lemon juice so he added some shredded Parmesan cheese. Wonderful flavorful layers!
This was SO good, we barely had enough for 3 people. I forgot the red pepper, and added wine instead of water. There are definitely no leftovers. Thank you, Chef John! You are a national treasure!

Incredible! There was so much flavour in this dish and it worked well over spaghetti noodles. I would double the recipe though because it was not quite enough for 2 people. The video was super helpful too.

I'm making this now :)
I love your video comments, you are funny, a pleasure to listen to while watching your recipe, thank you!
Over all was good but calls for way too much lemon juice. I would only use 1/2 of the suggest amount.

This was great. Made as noted except increased oil & butter to 2T each. Used T heaping T of minced garlic in a jar to make it even quicker. Served over whole wheat pasta. One suggestion as others have mentioned...maybe remove the shrimp after first minute and add back in after sauce is mixed...very easy to overcook the shrimp. My 16 count/# were borderline overcooked. Was still very delicious.
So simple and delicious!!
Enough sauce to serve with pasta.
No changes, it was very good.
Delicious and simple, will be doing this regularly!

This is one of the absolute best recipes I’ve found on this site! The only change I made was to add a little Chile pepper red sauce. Omg, this was so delicious!! Hubby couldn’t stop eating it. I served it with brown rice, green salad and garlic bread! Thanks so much for sharing the recipe!
I followed the recipe word by word ... its my favorite way to eat shrimp ... Chef Jhon is the best
No, I won't make it again. It was somewhat bland for me
No, I won't make it again. It was somewhat bland for me

Absolutely delicious! I used Argentinian Red Shrimp, doubled the butter garlic sauce recipe, and tossed it with pasta. I don’t typically like to eat shrimp any other way than dipped in spicy cocktail sauce, but this was so good! I’m going to add it to our dinner rotation. Make sure you prep and measure everything before you start because once you get going, it comes together really fast.

Thanks Chef John and others,

Replaced caper brine with green olive juice. Served over pasta stuffed with cheese. Orderly laid out ingredients like all of you suggested. Cheryl said, "This has a kick to it." Blessings, Jack
I didnt have parsley or the brine and it was still very good

Turned out really well, would have been perfect but i think the recipe calls for to much red pepper flakes. Instead of just caper brine I added capers a teaspoon, added nice flavor. I will make again but cut back on pepper.
Added a little Alfredo Sauce to the recipe sauce as I was cooking it down and served it over fresh fettuccini. Excellent dish!!!

This was very good. I did cook it a bit differently than stated (was being lazy)! I heated up two tablespoons of butter and just threw everything in. Except the caper brine, no clue what that is. Cooked the shrimp for about three minutes and it was perfect. My favorite ingredient was the crushed red pepper flakes. It added just the tiniest touch of heat. Very lovely.
Great! Excellent! A hit! I didn't have any fresh parsley and I don't like lemon. It was still awesome. Shrimp, garlic, olive oil, and vegan butter and it was DELICIOUS! The family loved all of it

My husband said this should be rated 10 stars!!! Yes, it's that Good!!! Thanks again Chef John for another delicious recipe!!
Because of dietary restrictions substituted plant based butter.
It was still fantastic!
A great, easy recipe! I followed the recipe without changes.
I didnt have caper brine so I substituted black olive brine, and it was fine

I've made this recipe several times as is and it is wonderful. 3 WW points per serving. To make it a little more substantial, remove shrimp, deglaze the pan with a little white wine, add 1/2 cup of cream and 1/2 cup of parmesean cheese and return shrimp and mix in some capers to pan. Either way, you can't go wrong with this one.
Awesome
Quick, easy and very tasty.

This popped up yesterday in an email from Allrecipes.com as one of the '15 Quick-Prep Recipes for Easy Summer Dinners'. I just happen to be interested in making something for dinner that had a protein other than chicken, pork, beef, or fish. 

This was wonderful! It far exceeded my expectations. The flavor profile was amazing. My husband told me it was one of the best things I had ever made. I served it over jasmine rice with a side of steam broccoli. The sauce that is made was ladled over everything. Caper brine as an ingredient??!!! Who knew!
Quick meal that impresses guests. I add extra butter for a light noodle coating. Top with a little park. Perfect every time.

This is probably my favorite recipe of all time. I just love it. So does everyone I serve it too. The perfect blend of flavors. You can use the sauce on all kinds of seafood. Delicious on scallops and fish. Wonderful recipe. Thank you.

A+++ I made this exactly according to the recupe with one change. I didn't have caper juice so I used garlic stuffed green Olive juice. It was devine! I love scallops and so I decided to use the same recipe. The only change I made was to wear both sides of the scallop before adding butter, etc. They were the best scallops I've ever had. This is my number 1, go-to recipe for sauteed seafood from now on. Thank you!!
Great balance of flavors!
I followed the recipe as it. It was SOOOO easy to make and was ABSOLUTELY delicious!! Added to the family meal menu !

Oh yeah. This is sooooo good. I fell into a great deal, two pounds of fresh caught shrimp for about $5. I have never peeled and deveined them before, but quickly learned to do them, and in about half an hour I had a pot of peeled shrimp ready to cook. Like many others, I had no caper juice, but used green olive brine and all the rest of the ingredients. 

We love garlic, but my hubby gets heartburn from too much, so I added about 1/4 cup of cream to the resultant sauce, and this was just soooo good. He couldn't quit eating it. I served it over pasta, and while I may never find a bargain like this again, I will make this again, without a doubt. I think it would be equally good with either fish or chicken. Thanks, Chef John. You are always reliable.
I don't care for capers at all - left the juice out and it was still fabulous!
I didn't change a thing and it was great!!
Delicious! Did not have fresh parsley so omitted it altogether - it was still absolutely delicious. Served over fettuccini noodles. Will definitely make again.

I made this for the second time. The first time it was delicious but a but too spicy for me. This time I cut the red pepper flakes in 1/2 . While I it wasn’t too spicy, it was lacking something. I guess it needs the red pepper flakes. Will make again. My husband also really liked it.
